# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

None.

Here is a function that wraps long strings to a specified text width:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    curr_len = 0
    result = ""
    for word in words
        if curr_len + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
            curr_len = 0
        end
        result *= word * " "
        curr_len += length(word) + 1
    end
    return result
end
```

It splits the input text into words, then iterates through, adding spaces and newlines as needed to wrap lines at the desired text width.

An example usage:

```julia
text = "This is a very long input string that exceeds the default text width"

print(wrap_string(text)) 
```

Would output:

```
This is a 
very long 
input string 
that exceeds 
the default 
text width
```
